commands.description: Locks and unlocks the day-night cycle.

arguments.description: Specifies whether the eternal daytime is locked or not.

commands.description: Used to enable a camera shaking effect.

arguments.description: Specifies the player(s) who's clients will be sent a camera shake request. If not specified, defaults to the command's executor (@s).
Specifies the intensity of the camera shake.
Specifies the duration of the camera shake.
Specifies the type of camera shake direction.

commands.description: Used to enable a camera shaking effect.

arguments.description: Specifies the player(s) who's clients will be sent a camera shake request. If not specified, defaults to the command's executor (@s).
Specifies the player(s) whose items are cleared. If not specified, defaults to the player who executes the command.
Specifies the item to be cleared. If not specified, all items are cleared.
Specifies the data value of the item to be cleared. If not specified, or if -1, all items that match itemName are cleared, regardless of their data.

Specifies the maximum number of items to be cleared. If not specified, or if -1, all items that match item, or itemName and data are cleared. If 0, instead of clearing of items, detects and queries the amount of specified items.
Specifies the player whose spawn point should be removed. If not specified, defaults to the command's executor (@s).

commands.description: Copies blocks from one place to another.

arguments.description: Specifies the coordinates of two opposing corner blocks of the source region.
Specifies the lower northwest corner of the destination region.
Specifies whether to filter the blocks being cloned.
Specifies how to treat the source region.

arguments.description: Specifies the coordinates of two opposing corner blocks of the source region.

arguments.description: Specifies the coordinates of two opposing corner blocks of the source region.

Specifies the block data to match when finding blocks to clone.
Specifies the new difficulty level.
Specifies the target(s).
Specifies the target(s).
Specifies the effect to be added or removed.

Specifies the effect's duration in seconds (or in gameticks for instant_damage, instant_health, and saturation). If not specified, defaults to 30 seconds (or 1 gameticks for instant_damage, instant_health, and saturation).

Specifies the number of additional levels to add to the effect. If not specified, defaults to 0. Note that the first tier of a status effect (e.g. Regeneration I) is 0, so the second tier, for example Regeneration II, would be specified by an amplifier level of 1.
Specifies whether the particles and the HUD indicatorâ€Œ of the status effect should be hidden. If not specified, defaults to false.

commands.description: Adds an enchantment to a player's selected item.

arguments.description: Specifies the target(s).
Specifies the enchantment to be added to the item held in main hand by the target.
Specifies the enchantment level. Should be not greater than the maximum level for the specified enchantment. If not specified, defaults to 1.

commands.description: Adds an enchantment to a player's selected item.

arguments.description: Specifies the target(s).

commands.description: Used to trigger an event on an entity.

arguments.description: Specifies the target(s) to execute an entity event.
Specifies the in-game event for the entity.
Specifies the target to be the command's executor. Must be a player name or target selector. If more than one entity is selected, the command is run once as each of them.
Specifies the position from which to run the command. coordinates specified with tilde and caret notation are relative to the target, not to the position of the command's execution.
Specifies the command to be run. Must be a valid command.
Specifies the target to be the command's executor. Must be a player name or target selector. If more than one entity is selected, the command is run once as each of them.
Specifies the position from which to run the command. coordinates specified with tilde and caret notation are relative to the target, not to the position of the command's execution.
Specifies the position of the block to check.
Specifies the block ID that the block at detectPos, must match for the command to run.
Must be a valid block data for that type of block or -1 to match any block data.
Specifies the command to be run. Must be a valid command.

commands.description: Used to run a one-off animation.

arguments.description: Specifies the targeted entities.
Should be an animation name.
Should be an animation name.
Specifies the duration of the gradient animation.
Specifies the conditions for stopping animation.
Should be an animation controller name.
Specifies the sound to play.
Specifies the sound's target.
Specifies the position to play the sounds from.

Specifies the distance that the sound can be heard. If not specified, defaults to 1. For values less than 1, the volume diminishes and the sound has a smaller sphere in which it may be heard. For values greater than 1, the sound does not actually grow louder, but its audible range (a 16-block radius at 1) is multiplied by volume. There is always a gradual falloff to silence based on distance from the center of the sphere. For values equal to or less than 0, no one can hear the sound.
Specifies the pitch of the sound. If not specified, defaults to 1.

Specifies the volume for targets outside the sound's normal audible sphere. If a target is outside the normal sphere, the sound is instead centered some short distance from the target (less than four blocks away), and this argument determines its volume.
